sentences.en: Deep late night, he walks pass dusty stairway, low cramp hallway.
sentences.cn: 深湛的夜, 他穿越白尘覆积的楼梯间, 局促低矮的走廊.

sentences.en: Faber had a cramp in his left calf.
sentences.cn: 费伯的左小腿感到麻木.

sentences.en: He lost all sensation in his legs through cramp.
sentences.cn: 他的腿部因抽筋而失去知觉.

sentences.en: Hillsden was complain-ing of cramp in his calf muscles.
sentences.cn: 希尔斯登说他小腿抽筋。

sentences.en: I hate a cramp, he thought.
It'should not cramp on me again unless it gets too cold in the night.
sentences.cn: 它不会再抽筋了,除非夜里太冷.

sentences.en: Like more and more women, she believes marriage would cramp her style.
sentences.cn: 像越来越多的女性一样，她认为婚姻会对她形成束缚。

sentences.en: My bedfellows are cough and cramp; we sleep three in a bed.
sentences.cn: 我的同衾者是咳嗽与痉挛, 咱们三个同睡一床.

sentences.en: My hand is only cut a little and the cramp is gone from the other.
sentences.cn: 我一只手仅仅割破了一点儿,另一只手的抽筋已经好了.

sentences.en: Several players were suffering from cramp.

sentences.cn: 这个游泳的人突然抽筋.

sentences.en: The swimmer was seized with a cramp and had to be helped out of the water.
sentences.cn: 那个在游泳的人突然抽起筋来,让别人帮着上了岸.

sentences.en: The swimmer was seized with cramp in cold water.
sentences.cn: 游泳者在冷水中忽然抽筋了.

sentences.en: to get cramp in your leg
Winston stopped writing, partly because he was suffering from cramp.
sentences.cn: 温斯顿驻了笔,手指也写麻了.

sentences.en: You got a cramp in your leg.

words.tran_cn: 用夹钳夹；约束（cramp的过去分词）
狭窄的；难解的；受限制的
痉挛，绞痛；[五金][机]铁夹钳
束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧

phrases.tran_cn: 限制或防止…自由行动或表述

trans.tran_cn: 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的
痛性痉挛，抽筋，（腹部）绞痛，夹子，扣钉，（制靴）弓状木
trans.tran_en: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body
to prevent the development of someone or something

trans.tran_cn: 使痉挛，使抽筋，<俚>使扫兴，用夹子夹紧，限制，束缚
